title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian equity markets experienced a marginal decline for the third consecutive session, influenced by global geopolitical tensions and ongoing FII outflows. Analysts anticipate a consolidation phase with profit-booking at higher levels, while sector-specific movements persist due to Q3 business updates.

title: Stocks in news: Angel One, Tata Steel, Shriram Finance, IndiGo, Eternal
summary: Markets extended their corrective phase on Wednesday, with the Nifty nearing support levels. Several companies are in focus today due to significant news. Angel One's board will meet to consider a stock split and dividend, while Tata Steel reported its best-ever quarterly crude steel production. IndiGo faces scrutiny over flight cancellations, and Eternal received a GST demand order.

title: Asian stocks fall as optimism fades, US bonds hold gains
summary: Asian markets saw a dip for the second day as a strong rally cooled. US Treasuries held their ground after gains. Samsung Electronics reported record profits but its stock fell. Mixed US economic data is influencing Federal Reserve rate cut expectations. Geopolitical concerns and economic outlook are also impacting markets.

title: Modulus Appoints Sandeep Agarwal as Chief Executive
summary: Modulus Alternatives has appointed Sandeep Agarwal as its new chief executive, effective January 1. Agarwal brings nearly 25 years of extensive experience in investment banking and private credit from prominent institutions like UBS AG, Credit Suisse, and JP Morgan. This strategic appointment is backed by the Centrum Group and Alok Agarwal, former CFO of Reliance Industries.

title: Equity likely to return about 10-12% in 2026: ABSL MF
summary: Aditya Birla Sun Life Mutual Fund anticipates equity returns of 10-12% in 2026. Nifty companies are expected to see earnings growth in the low to mid-teens. Large-cap stocks are predicted to outperform mid and small-cap peers. The fund house is overweight on IT, FMCG, and materials. Harish Krishnan succeeds Mahesh Patil as CIO, equity.

title: Strong Q3 sales and rising gold demand lift jewellery stocks
summary: Gold jewellery stocks surged on Wednesday. Titan Company, Kalyan Jewellers India, and Senco Gold reported strong third-quarter sales. This positive market sentiment is expected to continue. Analysts point to rising gold prices and consistent sales growth as key drivers.  Titan's jewellery business grew 41% year-on-year. Senco's revenue was up 51%. Kalyan Jewellers saw consolidated revenue growth of approximately 42%.

title: FPIs dump FMCG, Financial Services in second half of December; IT sees inflows
summary: Foreign investors divested ₹16,848 crore from Indian markets in the latter half of December. FMCG and financial services saw major outflows. However, the information technology sector attracted ₹4,457 crore in inflows, marking the first positive fortnight since June. This shift indicates a change in global investor sentiment towards Indian equities.

title: Stock Radar: Tata Steel hits record highs in January 2026; will the rally continue?
summary: Tata Steel's shares have hit an all-time high following a phase of stabilization. Analysts suggest that investors seize the opportunity to buy with a target of Rs 215 within the upcoming month or two. The stock demonstrates robust upward trends, consistently trading above crucial moving averages.

title: PNB puts on the block ₹760 cr of bad loans
summary: Punjab National Bank is selling bad loans exceeding ₹760 crore, including significant exposures to Gammon India and Simbhaoli Sugars. This follows a larger sale attempt last week of ₹2,500 crore in non-performing assets. The bank aims to recover at least 40-50% of the identified ₹4,000-5,000 crore in bad loans.

title: SBI awards Rs 1,000-crore ATM management mandate to CMS
summary: State Bank of India has awarded a significant Rs 1000 crore, 10-year contract to CMS Info Systems. This deal covers cash outsourcing for 5,000 ATMs across India. The agreement will enhance cash efficiency and ATM uptime for millions of customers. The project is set to begin in January 2026. This marks a major step in bank outsourcing.

Angel One shares have started 2026 with a gain.

title: Tata Steel shares in focus after company reports best-ever quarterly deliveries in Q3
summary: Tata Steel reported its best-ever quarterly crude steel production and deliveries for Q3FY26, with production reaching 6.34 million tons, a 12% increase year-on-year and sequentially. Domestic deliveries also hit a record, crossing 6 million tons, driven by strong demand across key segments like Automotive and Branded Products.

title: With an army of agents at its disposal, LIC Mutual Fund plans a comeback
summary: Left on the back burner for decades, the company now plans to tap its parent firm’s vast network of insurance agents to meet its  ₹1 trillion AUM target. But experts warn that even the widest reach can’t compensate for the persistent underperformance of its biggest equity schemes.

title: Shriram Finance shares in focus as board mulls Rs 39,618 crore funding from MUFG
summary: Shriram Finance shares are in focus ahead of an EGM on January 14, where shareholders will vote on a Rs 39,618 crore capital infusion from Japan's MUFG Bank. The deal involves a 20% stake dilution via preferential allotment. Proxy advisors ISS and InGovern recommend voting in favor, citing fair pricing and safeguards.

summary: The integration of Infosys Topaz Fabric and Cognition’s autonomous engineering tech is expected to fast-track software development and modernisation.

title: Sensex drops over 200 pts, Nifty below 26,150 amid tariff jitters and foreign selling
summary: Indian equities opened lower on Thursday, with both the Sensex and Nifty extending a cautious trend for the fourth consecutive session. Concerns over U.S. tariffs and ongoing foreign fund outflows are weighing on the market, despite some positive sentiment from earnings growth.

title: Nifty valuations frozen for a year but Q3 earnings season could finally break the spell
summary: India's Nifty50 has seen stagnant valuations for a year, but the upcoming Q3 earnings season could be a turning point. Analysts are divided, with some predicting a sharp rebound driven by banks, telecom, and metals, while others foresee continued soft earnings. The market is at an inflection point, with stock selection becoming crucial for potential gains.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Nuvama maintains a Hold on Indigo; Morgan Stanley recommends overweight on Aditya Birla Capital

summary: As of January 7, five stocks in the NSE F&O segment recorded a sharp rise in futures open interest, signalling heightened derivatives activity. Rising open interest reflects growing trader participation, with fresh positions being created or existing ones expanded, indicating increasing conviction on the near-term price direction.

title: Sebi alleges BofA unit breached rules in 2024 AB Sun Life ‌AMC deal: Report
summary: India's market regulator has accused a Bank of America unit of breaking insider trading rules. The bank's deal team allegedly shared confidential information with its broking and research arms. These teams then contacted potential investors about a share sale. The regulator found a failure in internal controls. The bank is seeking to settle the charges without admitting guilt.

title: Lemon Tree shares in focus as firm denies media reports of Warburg Pincus acquiring stake
summary: Lemon Tree Hotels shares are under scrutiny after denying reports of a Warburg Pincus stake. The company clarified no ongoing discussions or agreements exist.  Previously, the stock rose on the speculation. Lemon Tree operates over 110 properties.  A new hotel in Tirupati was announced.  The stock saw modest gains in 2025 and is down in 2026.

Adani Green shares in focus as unit signs captive hybrid power deal with Asahi India Glass

summary: On January 7, five stocks from the Nifty200 universe flashed bullish signals after appearing on the White Marubozu scanner. This candlestick pattern reflects strong buying interest throughout the session, indicating firm buyer control and suggesting the potential for continued upside momentum, closely tracked by traders for short-term opportunities.

summary: With the Nifty at record highs, defence, railways and critical minerals are emerging as key bets as India doubles down on self-reliance, infrastructure and strategic manufacturing.

summary: Warren Buffett's timeless investing principles still offer a powerful lens for spotting Indian companies with strong fundamentals, durable moats, and valuations shaped by short-term pessimism rather than long-term decline.

title: TVS Motor tops two-wheeler pack with 60% rally. How far can the fuel last?
summary: TVS Motor Company shares have surged 60% in the past year, outperforming peers and the Nifty index. With strong fundamentals and a supportive technical structure, brokerages anticipate further upside of up to 16%. The company's robust earnings growth and positive sales figures underpin this optimistic outlook.

title: LG Electronics' three-month IPO anchor lock-in ends today, 1.5 cr additional shares now eligible for trade
summary: LG Electronics India will be in focus as its three-month IPO anchor lock-in ends today, freeing 1.5 crore shares for trade. The stock remains 28% above its issue price, even as recent quarterly results showed weaker profitability. Analysts stay optimistic, citing strong brand positioning and long-term growth visibility.

title: Adani Power, Tata Motors among 8 stocks with up to 72% upside as brokerages initiate coverage
summary: Brokerages initiated coverage on eight Indian stocks—including Adani Power, Tata Motors, Groww and Coforge—projecting up to 72% upside on strong sectoral tailwinds and earnings visibility.

title: Ahead of Q3, HDFC Securities recommends a buy on Infosys, HCL, 5 more IT stocks for up to 52% upside
summary: Ahead of a seasonally weak Q3FY26, HDFC Securities has recommended buy ratings on seven Indian IT stocks, including Infosys and HCL. Despite near-term headwinds like furloughs and macro uncertainty, these stocks offer potential upside of up to 52%. The brokerage anticipates modest sequential growth for most, with some expected to raise FY26 revenue guidance.

title: Thangamayil Jewellery shares jump 28% in just 3 sessions. What’s behind the sharp surge?
summary: Thangamayil Jewellery shares saw a significant rise. This surge followed strong third-quarter business updates from rival companies. Titan Company and Senco Gold reported robust growth. Kalyan Jewellers also posted impressive revenue increases. Thangamayil itself had a strong turnaround in its September quarter results. This positive performance is driving investor interest.

title: Coal India's five-year run creates Rs 1.8 lakh crore wealth for investors. Can Bharat Coking Coal match it?
summary: Coal India's five-year run generated Rs 1.8 lakh crore in investor wealth, driven by commodity cycles and PSU re-rating. Now, its subsidiary Bharat Coking Coal (BCCL) seeks funds, aiming to replicate this success with its strategic coking coal assets and expansion plans.

title: Anil Agarwal's journey: A look at the mining mogul's legacy, leadership and resilience
summary: According to the Forbes Real Time Billionaire's list, Anil Aggarwal has a net worth of $3.3 billion. Most of his wealth comes from his majority stake at Vedanta.

title: NALCO shares retreat 6% after 4-day rally. Are metals losing momentum?
summary: Shares of NALCO fell on Thursday, ending a four-day, 14% rally, as profit booking hit India’s metals sector. All 15 stocks on the Nifty Metal index traded lower amid cooling global commodity prices and stretched valuations.

title: Budget may tap oil windfall? JM Financial flags excise-duty risk for HPCL, BPCL, IOCL; backs Oil India, ONGC
summary: JM Financial advises caution on oil marketing companies (OMCs) like HPCL, IOCL, and BPCL due to potential excise duty hikes in the upcoming budget. The brokerage reiterates buy ratings on upstream producers Oil India and ONGC, citing attractive valuations and medium-term production growth potential amidst subdued crude prices.

title: Indian top IT firms set for another tepid quarter on weak US demand, client spending
summary: As Indian IT companies gear up for what is expected to be a slow quarter, weak demand from the U.S. continues to dampen tech spending. Market analysts project only slight increases in revenue and profits for leading firms. Nevertheless, the growing trend of AI integration and a potential resurgence in 2026 could provide a silver lining.

title: Jio IPO may re-rate Bharti Airtel, says Jefferies; raises target price
summary: Jefferies says Jio’s planned IPO in the first half of 2026 could act as a re-rating trigger for Bharti Airtel, aided by tariff hikes and a higher sector weight in indices. The brokerage has raised Bharti Airtel’s target price to Rs 2,760, implying 32% upside, and maintains it as its top pick in Indian telecom.

title: HDFC Bank shares fall 4% in 4 sessions. Will Q3 results change the script?
summary: HDFC Bank shares saw a dip as investors await third-quarter results. Analysts predict steady balance-sheet growth. While margins may face some pressure, asset quality and cost discipline are expected to remain strong. The bank's expanding rural network is boosting market share. Investors will watch for priority sector lending compliance and borrowing repayment.

title: Hindustan Copper shares fall over 4% as copper prices retreat
summary: Hindustan Copper shares fell sharply for a second session, tracking weakness in global copper prices after a strong rally. Profit-taking emerged as copper corrected from record highs, while elevated valuations and overbought technical indicators signalled near-term caution, despite the stock maintaining a positive broader trend and rising institutional interest.

title: Ashish Kacholia portfolio: BSE SME stock hits upper circuit for third straight session after ace investor's stake raise
summary: SME stock Adcounty Media India had released its December quarter shareholding data on Monday, January 5, which showed Ashish Kacholia holding a 2.92% stake or 656000 shares in the company.

title: Penny stock under Re 1 Dharan Infra-EPC his upper circuit; here's why
summary: In an exchange filing on Tuesday, Dharan Infra-EPC said that the suspended board of directors of the company has preferred an appeal before the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT), seeking a stay on the CIRP proceedings.

title: De Beers: Titan’s lab-grown push won’t dull real diamonds
summary: Titan recently launched a lab-grown diamond brand beYon while other lab-grown diamond jewellery retailers continue to raise funding. De Beers says India’s appetite for natural diamonds remains intact.&nbsp;

title: Sensex tumbles 1,500 points in 4 days, Rs 7 lakh crore erased: Trump tariffs and 4 reasons behind market sell-off
summary: Why market is down today? Indian stock markets are experiencing a significant downturn. Benchmarks have fallen for four consecutive sessions. Investors are reacting to global geopolitical issues and potential U.S. tariffs. Corporate earnings reports are also mixed. This combination of factors is causing a broad market decline. The Sensex and Nifty 50 have both seen substantial losses.

title: Kalyan Jewellers shares slip 1% despite 42% YoY revenue jump in Q3 update
summary: Kalyan Jewellers’ shares slipped marginally on Thursday despite a strong Q3 update, with consolidated revenue surging 42% YoY on festive-driven demand. Same-store sales rose 27%, international revenue grew 36%, and Candere posted a 147% jump.

title: Nifty 50 dips 200 points, Sensex crashes 600 points; why is Indian stock market down today?

title: Why Titan’s lab-grown diamond bet looks carefully crafted
summary: There are concerns that customers of CaratLane and Mia (Titan’s lower-end jewellery brands compared to Tanishq) would shift to beYon. However, the management believes that beYon is unlikely to cannibalize the existing customer demand significantly

title: Mukesh Ambani–backed Alok Industries rallies over 8% amid high volumes, hits 2-week high
summary: Alok Industries' stock price jumped 8.5% to  ₹17.21, attracting attention despite broader market losses. Trading volumes soared to 23.3 million shares, indicating strong interest. Reliance Industries held 40% of the company at the end of the September quarter.
